titleStmt.title: R. R. Clark et al. to Thomas E. Bramlette
CWG5582

availability.p: This image and transcription is publicly accessible. The image appears courtesy of the repository named in the Source Description. The transcription and annotation were undertaken by Kentucky Historical Society staff, volunteers, and interns. If referencing this document title, accession number, and permanent URL.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition
Early Access

msIdentifier.repository: Kentucky Department for Libraries and Archives
msIdentifier.collection: Office of the Governor, Thomas E. Bramlette: Governor's official correspondence file, petitions for pardons, remissions, and respites 1863-1867

body.p:
To his Excellency
Thos E. Bramlette
Governor of Kentucky

We the undersigned citizens of Jefferson and Shelby Counties respectfully ask and petition your Excellency to interpose the executive clemency in behalf of Mrs. Anne Netherton a resident of Long Run in Jefferson County by remitting the penalty of One Hundred Dollars for which She is now, through that "Sympathy so common to woman," bound to the Commonwealth._ A black man named Peter who had formerly belonged to her and was still living with her had been arrested for marking a hog and claiming it as his- not his own. He was tried in an examining Court by esquires Conn and Hobbs found guilty ^of Felony^ and held in a bond of One Hundred Dollars for his appearance Mrs. Netherton went on his bond to keep him from Jail. He has now left for parts unknown, We therefore pray your Excellency to remit the payment of the Bond in behalf of this old lady now seventy years of age and poorly able to sustain so great a loss.

R. R. Clark
John McNeil Esqr
Jeptha Shouse
J C. Johnson
J V Frazier
J Frazier
John Frazier
The Gov Will please remit the fine by an earlier mail if at all

Jefferson C C
vs
Mrs Anne Netherton
